attributes.deal.rationale: NETHERLANDS - Hydratec Industries NV planned to acquire a 75% interest in Rollepaal Holding BV, a Dedemsvaart-based manufacturer of plastics pipes and pipe fittings, from Wadinko NV.
EAO Holding agreed to acquire Highland Electronics from Arlen from 3.6 mil British pounds ($5.3 mil US) in cash.

BRAZIL - HCA Participacoes SA, a unit of PARIT Participacoes SA, acquired the remaining 39.901% stake, or 0.837 mil ord shares and 5. 230 mil pref shares, which it did not already own, in Altus Sistemas de Automacao SA, a Sao Leopoldo-based manufacturer and wholesaler of industrial automation equipment and integrated systems, from BNDES Participacoes SA BNDESPAR, a unit of the Brazilian state- owned Banco Nacional de Desenvolvimento Economico e Social.

SOUTH KOREA - Kiwoomline Co Ltd, acquired a 30.541% stake or 2.594 mil new ordinary shares in Turbotek Co Ltd, an Asan-based provider of computer numerical controllers, for an amended KRW 2 bil (USD 1.898 mil) or KRW 771 (USD 0.732) per share, in a privately negotiated transaction. Originally, BD Holdings Co Ltd planned to raised its stake to 38.339% from 2.871% by acquiring a further 35.468% stake or 3. 243 mil new ordinary shares in Turbotek Co Ltd, for a sweetened KRW 2.5 bil (USD 2. 473 mil) or KRW 771 (USD 0. 763) per share, in a privately negotiated transaction. Originally, individual investors offered KRW 500 (USD 0.476) per share or a total value of KRW 2.5 mil (USD 2.378 mil).
SOUTH KOREA - Turbotek Co Ltd acquired the entire share capital in Jeongwon P&G Co Ltd, a Hwaseong-based manufacturer of wood products and machinery, for a total value of KRW 2 bil (USD 1.864 mil).
NETHERLANDS - Hydratec Industries NV planned to acquire a 75% interest in Stork Plastics Machinery BV, a Hengelo-based manufacturer of industrial machinery, from Wadinko NV.

FRANCE - Acrelec SAS acquired an undisclosed minority stake in Dreamtronic SARL, an Angouleme-based manufacturer of computer peripheral equipment, for a total EUR 0. 7 mil (USD 0.774 mil), in a privately negotiated transaction.
SPAIN - Frontmatec A/S of Denmark,acquired a 40% stake in ASSESSORAMENT INDUSTRIAL ROBOTICA I AUTOMATITZACI, SL, a Cardona-based provider of computer systems design services.

SWITZERLAND - Eaton Corp of the US acquired the remaining 50% interest, which it did already own in Micro Innovation AG, a Saint Gallen- based manufacturer and wholesaler of machine interfaces. Terms were not disclosed.

TAIWAN - Beijer Electronics AB acquired the entire share capital of Hitech Electronics Corp, an electronic terminal manufacturer, from Densitron Technologies PLC and other undisclosed sellers, for an estimated 519.893 mil Taiwanese dollars (115 mil Swedish kronor/$16.766 mil US)

NETHERLANDS - Nyloplast NV acquired man machine interfaces activities of Danielson Sverige AB, a provider of industrial graphics services. The transaction includes the activities in the Netherlands, UK, and undisclosed activities in Sweden.

SOUTH KOREA - An investor group, comprised of Sangjin Cha (9.911%), Hyeonwoo Nam (9. 705%), Daehyui Jo (7.959%), Dongho Shin (5.135%), Hyeongyol Han (5.135%), Jeongho Lee (2.311%) and Jaejun Lee (1.695%), acquired a 41.851% stake or 43.278 mil new ordinary shares in Turbotek Co Ltd, an Asan- based manufacturer and wholesaler of controlling devices, in exchange for 0. 815 mil Markpro Co Ltd's new issued shares valued at KRW 22.461 bil (USD 19.429 mil) in a reverse takeover. Upon completion, Turbotek Co Ltd will own a 94.22% interest in Markpro Co Ltd.
US - Wonderware Corp, a unit of Invensys PLC, acquired SAT Corp, a developer of mobile workforce and decision support system software, for $52 mil in cash.

IRELAND - DiSTI Corp of US acquired Havok Inc, a Dublin- based develops interactive software with expertise in physics, animation and tools for digital media creators in the games and movie industries.

SWEDEN - SEB Asset Management SA of Luxembourg, a unit of Skandinaviska Enskilda Banken AB, acquired an undisclosed minority stake in Beijer Electronics AB, a Malmoe- based provider of automation services, in a privately negotiated transaction.

UK - Image Precision Ltd acquired vision system display business from bankrupt Brimar Ltd, a Manchester-based manufacturer and wholesaler of displays and components and a wholly- owned unit of Giles Briggs Holdings Ltd, a unit of PH Giles & Co Ltd. Terms were not disclosed.

CZECH REPUBLIC - Kontron Embedded Computers AG (KEC), of Germany, acquired a 70% interest in Merz SRO, Liberec- based software developer, in exchange for KEC ordinary shares valued at 31.10 mil korunas (1.8 mil marks/$0.790 mil).

NETHERLANDS - Hydratec Industries NV acquired the remaining 25% stake, which it did not already own, in Timmerije Holding BV, a Neede- based intermediator, from Wadinko NV. Concurrently, Wadinko acquired Euro Moulding BV, a Nijverdal- based manufacturer of plastics products, from Hydratec Industries, in a leveraged buyout transaction.
US - IData Visual Systems Inc, unit of ENSCO Inc acquired IData & IGL 178 assets, unit of Quantum3D Inc, a San Jose- based developer of 3D graphic systems.

FINLAND - Beijer Electronics AB of Sweden signed a Letter of Intent {LOI} to acquire the Mitsubishi inverter business of UTU Powel Oy, a Pori-based wholesaler and retailer of electrotechnical products, power electronics, components and drives, a wholly-owned unit of Urho Tuominen Oy. Terms were not disclosed. The transaction was to include businesses in Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania.
SPAIN - Frontmatec A/S of Denmark acquired Industrial Tecnico Alimentaria SA, a L'Hospitalet De Llobregat- based food technology machinery and equipment distributor.
DENMARK - BV Electronic A/S acquired Dansk Styringsteknik A/S, an Odense-based provider of automation solutions.
CANADA - Cimation of the US acquired Synergist SCADA Inc, a Calgary-based provider of automation services.
TAIWAN - Kontron Embedded Computers AG acquired a 51% interest, in Industrial Solutions Provider Ltd, a software developer, for 82. 427 mil Taiwanese dollars (5. 412 mil Deutsche Mark/$2.5 mil US)
US - GGI Solutions of Canada acquired membrane switch business of Bergquist Co, a Chanhassen-based manufacturer and wholesaler of thermal management products, ultimately owned by Henkel AG & Co KGaA.

US - Micronet Ltd of Israel, a unit of Micronet Enertec Technologies Inc, definitively agreed to acquire Mobile Resource Management/FM business from Beijer Electronics Inc, a Salt Lake City-based designer, manufacturer, and supplier of human machine interface (HMI) and mobile data terminals, for USD 6.5 mil in cash.
SOUTH KOREA - Turbo-Teck acquired a 60% interest in Tekville.Com Co Ltd, an online educational services provider, for 1.2 bil Korean won ($0.95 mil US).

CANADA - Kontron Embedded Computers AG (KEC) acquired all the outstanding common stock of Memotec Communications Inc (MCI), a provider of data, voice and video convergence solution services for telecommunications carriers, Internet service providers and corporate customers, in a stock swap transaction valued at 57.573 mil Canadian dollars ($38.108 mil US). KEC offered 0.034 common shares per MCI share, subject to a collar agreement whereby a maximum of 0.55 mil common shares were to be issued. Based on KEC's closing stock price of C$120.376 ($79.677) on February 8, the last full trading day prior to the announcement, each MCI share was valued at C$4.093 ($2.709) .
SWEDEN - Beijer Electronics acquired Autic System AB, Landskrona-based wholesaler of computer equipment, from management. Terms were not disclosed.

SOUTH KOREA - Kang Moon-seok planned to acquire a 3.1% stake, or 1.835 mil ordinary shares, in Turbotek Co Ltd, a software developer, for 700 Korean won ($0.763 US) per share, or a total value of 1. 285 bil won ($1.4 mil), in a privately negotiated transaction.

SOUTH KOREA - All & G Co Ltd acquired a 5.04% stake, or 3. 571 mil ordinary shares, in Turbotek Co Ltd, a software developer, for 700 Korean won ($0.755 US) per share, or a total value of 2.5 bil won ($2.698 mil), in a privately negotiated transaction.
US - Cubic Corp acquired Intific Inc, a Peckville- based developer of software and game-based solutions. Terms were not disclosed.

SOUTH KOREA - An investor group, comprised of Seongjun Yoon (3.124%) and Gyuntae Jung (3.124%) acquired warrants converted into a 6. 248% stake or 0.392mil newly issued ordinary shares in Turbotek Co Ltd, an Ansan- based provider of IT and consulting services, in a privately negotiated transaction. These warrants were 'out-of-the-money' so that the deal value was not applicable.

TAIWAN - Kontron Embedded Computers AG raised its interest to 63% from 8%, by acquiring a 55% interest, in Taiwan Mycomp Corp, a computer hardware manufacturer, for 449.106 mil Taiwanese dollars (31.8 mil Deutsche mark/$13.635 mil US).

GERMANY - The HMI Products area of Beijer Electronics AB of Sweden acquired Elektronik Systeme Lauer GmbH & Co KG, an Unterensingen-based manufacturer and wholesaler of HMI products, from Augusta Technologie AG, for 6 mil euros (55.259 mil Swedish kronor/$8.072 mil US) in cash.

MALAYSIA - Xiamen Intretech Inc of China planned to raise its interest to 92%, from 80%, by acquiring a further 12% stake in Intretech (Malaysia) Sdn Bhd, a manufacturer of synthetic rubber, for a total MYR 46.276 mil (USD 11.14 mil) in cash, in a privately negotiated transaction. Concurrently, Xiamen Intretech Inc of China planned to raise its interest to 86.52%, from 80%, by acquiring a further 6.52% stake in Intretech (Malaysia) Sdn Bhd.
IRELAND - Beijer Electronics AB of Sweden acquired the entire share capital of Virtual Access (Ireland) Ltd, a Dublin-based manufacturer of telephone apparatuses.

US - Kontron Embedded Computers AG planned to acquire the remaining 49% stake, or 7.327 mil common shares, which it did not already own in Kontron Mobile Computing Inc, a manufacturer of computing platforms, for $0.45 in cash per share, or a total value of $5.443 mil. The transaction was subject to execution of a definitive merger agreement.

US -Kontron Embedded Computers AG acquired Industrial Computer Source Inc (ICS), a manufacturer of computers, from Acterna Corp, formerly Dynatech Corp, for $23 mil in cash. During the course of the transaction, ICS was renamed ICS Advent.
US - Wonderware Corp, a unit of Invensys PLC, agreed to acquire the QI Analyst 4.0 statistical process control product unit, from SPSS Inc, a developer of computer software, for $2 mil in cash.

NETHERLANDS - Nyloplast NV acquired a 75% interest in Timmerije Holding BV, a Neede- based investment company, from Wadinko NV. Concurrently, Nyloplast acquired a 75% interest in Euro Moulding BV. Terms were not diclosed.
US - Georgiana Ventures LLC acquired an undisclosed minority stake in Tactual Labs Co, a New York-based provider of research and development services, in a privately negotiated transaction.

SOUTH KOREA - Alanze Inc raised its stake to 17.93% from 13.67%, by acquiring a further 4.26% stake, or 1.364 mil ordinary shares, in Turbotek Co Ltd, a precision controller manufacturer, for 2.240 bil Korean won ($1.882 mil US) in cash, in a privately negotiated transaction.

SOUTH KOREA - Turbotek Co Ltd (Turbotek) merged with Paganica Co Ltd, a Chuncheon- based provider of golf franchise service, in exchange for 2.06 mil Turbotek's common shares valued at KRW 1.116 bil (USD 1.05 mil). The shares were valued based on Turbotek's closing stock price of KRW 542 (USD 0.51) on 31 August 2011, the last full trading day prior to the announcement.

TAIWAN - Sentelic Corp planned to merge E-Com Technology Corp, a New Taipei- based electronic parts and equipment merchant wholesaler, a unit of Vic-Dawn Enterprise Co Ltd, ultimately owned by Nichidenbo Corp.
Fonix Corp agreed to acquire all the outstanding stock of 3D Planet Inc. Terms were not disclosed.
NETHERLANDS - Hydratec Industries NV acquired Helvoet Holding BV, a Hellevoetsluis-based manufacturer of rubber products.

SPAIN - Molins Capital Inversion SCR SA, a unit of Active Capital Partners SA, acquired an undisclosed minority stake in Xperience Consulting SL, a Barcelona- based provider of information technology services.

NETHERLANDS - Hydratec Industries NV acquire a 88.5% interest in Lias Industries BV (Lias), a Zeddam-based manufacturer and wholesaler of industrial machinery, for an estimated EUR 17.5 mil (USD 24.058 mil) in cash. Originally, Hydratec Industries signed a Letter of Intent (LoI) to acquire 85% interest in Lias.

SOUTH KOREA - An investor group, comprised of Markpro Co and Sangjin Cha raised their stake to 19.914% from 1. 351% by acquiring a further 18.562% stake or 9.709 mil new ordinary shares in Turbotek Co Ltd, an Ansan- based provider of security system services, for KRW 515 (USD 4.29) per share or a total value of KRW 5 bil (USD 4.39 mil), in a privately negotiated transaction.
SOUTH KOREA - Turbotek Co Ltd acquired a 40% stake or 0.098 mil shares in Markstone Co Ltd, a Gwangju-based manufacturer of smart grid, for KRW 4 bil (USD 3.464 mil) in cash.
US - ITT Industries Inc acquired Man-Machine Interface, a provider of mobile telecommunications services, from TRW Inc, for $60 mil.

DENMARK - In December 2018, Axcel Management A/S was rumored to be seeking a buyer for a 48% stake in Frontmatec A/S, a Kolding-based software publisher, a unit of Via Venture Partners A/S, ultimately owned by Helmsoe- Zinck Holding ApS.

NETHERLANDS - Nyloplast NV acquired a 75% interest in Euro Moulding BV, a Nijverdal- based manufacturer of plastic containers, from Wadinko NV. Concurrently, Nyloplast acquired a 75% interest in Timmerije Holding BV. Terms were not disclosed.
US - Kontron Embedded Computers AG of Germany acquired a 51% interest, or 4. 536 mil common shares, in Fieldworks Inc, manufacturer of computing platforms, for $5.4 mil.

BRAZIL - Inova Empresa FIP, a unit of the Brazilian state- owned Financiadora de Estudos e Projetos, agreed to acquire a 10.12% stake in Altus Sistemas de Automacao SA, a Sao Leopoldo-based manufacturer of switchgear and switchboard apparatuses, a unit of HCA Participacoes SA, jointly owned by RFAC Participacoes SA and LFG Participacoes SA, in a privately negotiated transaction.
SWEDEN - Beijer Electronics AB definitely agreed to acquire Westermogruppen Group, a provider of software services. Terms were not disclosed.

INDIA - Mitsubishi Electric India Pvt Ltd, a wholly-owned unit of Mitsubishi Electric Corp merged with Messung Systems Pvt Ltd, a Pune-based manufacturer of programmable logic controllers (PLCs) and human machine interfaces (HMIs).

UK - Frontmatec A/S of Denmark, a unit of Via Venture Partners A/S, acquired Accles & Shelvoke Ltd, a Coldfield-based manufacturer and wholesaler of humane slaughtering pistols, from LDC (Managers) Ltd, ultimately owned by Lloyds Banking Group PLC.

BRAZIL - Beijer Electronics AB (Beijer) of Sweden was granted an option to raise its stake to 49% from 15% by acquiring a 34% stake in Altus Sistemas de Automacao SA (Altus), a Sao Leopoldo- based manufacturer and wholesaler of industrial automation equipment, in a privately negotiated transaction. Concurrently, Beijer acquired a 15% stake in Altus.

Fonix acquired AcuVoice for an estimated $19.988 mil. The consideration consisted of $8 mil in cash and 2.7 mil restricted common shares valued at an indicated $11. 988 mil. The shares were valued at an indicated price of $4.44 per share.

US - Mitsubishi Electric Automation Inc of Japan, a wholly-owned unit of Mitsubishi Electric Corp, acquired a 19.9% stake in ICONICS Inc, a Foxborough- based developer of industrial automation and manufacturing intelligence software, in a privately negotiated transaction.

SOUTH KOREA - DB & SOFT Inc raised its stake to 27.47% from 4.16%, by acquiring a 23. 31% stake, or .091 mil ordinary shares, in TurBo- Teck, a software developer, for 6.017 bil Korean won ($4. 748 mil US) in cash, in a privately negotiated transaction.
GERMANY - Kontron Embedded Computers AG acquired Rotec Industrieautomation GmbH, Rastatt-based developer of software.

SOUTH KOREA - An investor group, comprised of TS Investment Co Ltd (3.095%), Gyuseon Chui (1.238%) and Enju Gwak (0.309%), agreed to acquire a 4.643% stake or 5. 156 mil new ordinary shares in Turbotek Co Ltd, an Asan- based manufacturer of controlling devices, for KRW 670 (USD 0.615) per share or a total value of KRW 3.454 bil (USD 3.171 mil), in a privately negotiated transaction.
US - Fonix Corp merged with Phonic Technologies Inc (PT) in a reverse stock swap transaction. PT shareholders were to receive 11,213,565 restricted shares of Fonix common stock.
DENMARK - Beijer Electronics AB of Sweden agreed to acquire Brodersen Automation A/S, a Roskilde-based wholesaler of electrical and electronic automation components. Terms were not disclosed.

TAIWAN - Beijer Electronics Corp, a wholly-owned unit of Beijer Electronics AB, acquired a 37.4% stake in Korenix Technology Co Ltd, a Taipei-based developer of industrial networking solutions, for TWD 173.745 mil (USD 5.4 mil).

US - Beijer Electronics AB (Beijer) acquired the entire share capital of QSI Corp, a Salt Lake City-based manufacturer of data terminals, for an estimated USD 35 mil. The consideration consisted of USD 12 mil and up to USD 23 mil in profit- related payments. On completion, QSI was renamed Beijer Electronics Inc.

CANADA - Drayton Harbor Resources Inc (DH) signed a Letter of Intent {LoI} to acquire all the outstanding stock of You i Labs Inc, a developer of software, in exchange for 0.5 mil DH common shares, valued at 0. 307 mil Canadian dollars ($0. 251 mil US). The shares were valued based on DH's closing stock price of C$0.613 ($0.5) on November 17, the last full trading day prior to the announcement.

SWEDEN - Svolder AB acquired a 6.818% stake, or 1.3 mil ordinary shares, in Beijer Electronics AB, a Malmo-based manufacturer of switchgear and switchboard apparatuses, in a privately negotiated transaction.
Nyloplast acquired De Naamplaat.

SOUTH KOREA - An investor group, comprised of Sujin Han (3.124%) and Yeonghui Seo (3. 124%) acquired warrants converted into a 6.248% stake or 0.392 mil newly issued ordinary shares in Turbotek Co Ltd, an Ansan-based provider of IT and consulting services, in a privately negotiated transaction. These warrants were 'out-of-the- money' so that the deal value was not applicable.
Fonix Corp (FC) acquired all the outstanding stock of Articulate Systems Inc for an undisclosed amount of cash and FC common stock.
US Invensys PLC acquired Indusoft LLC, an Austin-based developer of software for automation.

DENMARK - In October 2015, Via Venture Partners A/S, ultimately owned by Helmsoe- Zinck Holding ApS, announced that it was seeking a buyer for its Frontmatec A/S unit, a Kolding-based software publisher.
GERMANY - Kontron Embedded Computers AG merged with JUMPtec Industrielle Computertechnik AG, a computer boards manufacturing company. Terms were not disclosed.

US - An investor group, comprised of Dos Rios Partners LP and Akoya Capital Partners LLC, a unit of The Carlyle Group LLC acquired an undisclosed minority stake in DiSTI Corp, an Orlando-based provider of graphical user interface software and 3-D virtual maintenance training solutions, in a privately negotiated transaction.
Fonix Corp acquired Acuity Management Inc. Terms were not disclosed.
EAO Holding acquired Secme.

US - In January 2010, BAE Systems PLC, a London-based manufacturer of civil and military aircrafts, was rumored to be a seeking buyer for its Platform Solution unit. General Electric (GE), Eaton (ETN), and Warburg Pincus were rumoured potential bidders.

SOUTH KOREA - An investor group, comprised of Eungno Park, Myeongjin Ko, Hyeonlyeo Jang and Seungjin Lee, acquired a 10.637% stake or 11 mil ordinary shares in Turbotek Co Ltd, an Asan- based manufacturer of controlling devices, from Markpro Co Ltd, for a total value of KRW 5.5 bil (USD 4. 923 mil) or KRW 500 (USD 0. 448) per share, in a privately negotiated transaction.
